intro: Hieracium prinzii, commonly known as Prince's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium prinzii is often found in rocky or gravelly areas and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
